page.title: 04LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is a broad{lowland}area rising to the Blackdown Hills to the south. The area surrounding Trull and Staplehay is mainly agricultural, consisting of fields ranging from 30 to approximately 4 acres. These are enclosed by{hedgerows,}a natural habitat for wildlife and plants;thus making the area attractive. There are plenty of{trees,}mainly deciduous, so that the rolling landscape in summer is a rich mixture of green and brown. The only feature to disturb this rural landscape is the M5 motorway, which can occasionally be heard and seen!Elsewhere there are few signs of urban development since most of the {settlement}consists of isolated farms and occasional villages such as Trull and Staplehay.
